result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary J Stephens Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary J Stephens Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary J Stephens Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $67 VW surcharge paid in full with bond.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Ban from Dane County farmers market
-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone
Psychiatric evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended
DNA on file.  Take all prescribed medications as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary J Stephens Jr

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Gary J Stephens Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Frank John Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. DE maintains request to proceed pro se. Court grants waiver to an attorney. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s)2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #  1 . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   2
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to 21CM2183, 21CM2184

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Ban from Dane County farmers market
-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone

-DNA on file

-Psychiatric evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended

-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served:  5 (7/13/22 - 7/17/22)
-Days credit if revoked:  5

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K

Jury status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury selection on September 6, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on September 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on September 8, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on September 9, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Scheduling order as follows:
Discovery exchange by August 15, 2022
Plaintiff's lay and expert witness list and summaries due August 15, 2022
Defendant's lay and expert witness list and summaries due August 22, 2022
All motions including motions in limine due August 22, 2022

Defendant Gary J Stephens Jr in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Gary J Stephens Jr.  Attorney Frank John Remington with intern Kevin MaGee in court for State of Wisconsin. DE requesting to proceed pro se. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to proceeding pro se. DE requesting Attorney Gonzalez withdraw. Court grants requests and orders Attorney Gonzalez withdrawn from case. Motion for joinder of cases: 21CM1845, 21CM1936, 21CM1950, 21CM2045, 21CM2183, 21CM2184. Argument. DE objects to motion for joinder. Court orders cases joinded for trial. DE requests SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND verbally requested on record. Scheduling order completed.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not be in the State Street and Langdon area as indicated on attached map. 
- Defendant shall not be at the Dane County Farmer's Market on the Capitol Square. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

01:58 PM Defendant in court, in custody.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant declined assistance of SPD Attorney Cardamone. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
